text: Simon Denis Brown, Baron Brown of Eaton-under-Heywood, PC (9 April 1937 â€“ 7 July 2023) was a British lawyer and former Justice of the Supreme Court of the United Kingdom. Brown was appointed a High Court Judge in 1984 and assigned to the Queen's Bench Division, receiving a knighthood on his appointment. He became a Lord Justice of Appeal, a judge of the Court of Appeal of England and Wales, in 1992 and was made a Privy Counsellor in the same year. He was Vice- President of the Civil Division from 2001 to 2003. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2023 deaths Category:Law lords
